benchmark_details.name: DIALECT BENCH
benchmark_details.overview: DIALECT BENCH is the first-ever large-scale benchmark for NLP on language varieties, aggregating an extensive set of task-varied variety datasets (10 text-level tasks covering 281 varieties) to evaluate NLP system performance on different language varieties.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To unify dialectal datasets across different tasks and to foster research on language varieties and non-standard dialects.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The data quality and quantity, variety coverage vary significantly across tasks because of data scarcity issues.

data.source: Aggregated datasets from various NLP tasks focusing on non-standard dialects and language varieties.
data.annotation: Annotated using public datasets, mostly within NLP research frameworks.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on standard evaluation practices for each task.
methodology.interpretation: Performance is interpreted based on completion and accuracy of each task across various dialects.
methodology.baseline_results: Results are compared against standard varieties to identify performance gaps.
methodology.validation: Evaluated using zero-shot and few-shot techniques for dialectal understanding.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The benchmark does contain demographic breakdowns across language varieties.
targeted_risks.harm: The benchmark aims to identify and mitigate performance disparities among dialects.
